En tant que personne √† risque, je trouve d√©solant de constater que la France est incapable de d√©velopper une simple application qui est capitale pour la sant√© et la s√©curit√© des personnes.

Le contr√¥le dans les a√©roports en France doit √™tre du m√™me niveau avec des appareils de prise de temp√©rature non fiables. Pauvre France 

16/06/20 - L‚Äôapplication est simple d‚Äôutilisation mais il y a 2 gros soucis, le premier est la sollicitation excessive de la batterie, en l‚Äôutilisant il faut recharger 2 fois par jour un iPhone XR
Le second souci est la d√©sactivation de l‚Äôapplication lors de sa mise √† jour. A cause de ce dysfonctionnement je n‚Äôai pas eu de suivi pendant tout un WE, je m‚Äôen suis aper√ßu par hasard 3 jours apr√®s en essayant de convaincre quelqu‚Äôun d‚Äôutiliser l‚Äôapplication sans cela l‚Äôarr√™t du suivi aurait dur√©e beaucoup plus longtemps. Title Review:
Reliability gap 07/13/20 - 1 month after my previous review I see from reading all the comments posted since that there has been no correction to the recurring issues indicated in the reviews:
- untimely disconnections
- excessive battery consumption
All the people I had convinced to use the app  we decided not to use it anymore. As a person at risk  I find it sad to note that France is unable to develop a simple application which is essential for the health and safety of people.
The Chinese  Koreans and other countries who have set up their own app and very quickly have to laugh ...
Control at airports in France must be at the same level with unreliable temperature measuring devices. Poor France

06/16/20 - The application is easy to use but there are 2 big concerns  the first is the excessive demand on the battery  when using it you have to recharge an iPhone XR twice a day
The second concern is the deactivation of the application during its update. Because of this dysfunction I did not have a follow-up for a whole week  I noticed it by chance 3 days later while trying to convince someone to use the application without it stopping the follow-up would have duration much longer. I consider this disconnection without being informed of it as a total lack of reliability.

Title Review:

Deciding to trust French companies to find a solution rather than the two main players in the mobile market is a choice that I do not understand. In the meantime  I don't allow Bluetooth.

Quand au c√¥t√© liberticide je vous renvoie aux annonces d‚Äôun conseil de l‚Äôordre des avocats de Paris qui d√©conseille √† tous ces collaborateurs de l‚Äôinstaller...

Bref une app √† l‚Äôimage de ce gouvernement d‚Äôincomp√©tents qui n‚Äôa pas √©t√© fichu de fournir masques et gel √† sa population et de surcro√Æt √† ses soignants, en somme √† mettre √† la poubelle!
Title Review:
Useless  technically flawed and liberticidal Not only is this app costing 200 000 euros per month of public money totally useless because it arrives too late but it is strictly not used to fight against COVID-19 insofar as I do not see who will agree to voluntarily enter a bar code if it is contaminated with the risks of stigmatization that this entails.

On iPhone 11 Pro this placebo eats up your battery  because it has to constantly run in the background looking for other Bluetooth devices and will require you to leave your phone at home or at the office to recharge it. Or the opposite of the desired goal.

When on the liberticidal side  I refer you to the announcements of a council of the Paris Bar Association which advises all these collaborators not to install it ...

In short  an app in the image of this incompetent government that has not been damned to provide masks and gel to its population and moreover to its caregivers  in short to be thrown in the trash!

Title Review:

Apr√®s les nombreux d√©bats partisans lus ici ou l√† sur la pertinence, l‚Äôefficacit√©, la vuln√©rabilit√©, la malveillance ou le bien-fond√© de cette application, il semble que la controverse se poursuit ici ... et j‚Äôobserve que ses opposants n‚Äôont pas mobilis√© les meilleurs d‚Äôentre eux, pr√©f√©rant l‚Äôinvective ou la sentence capitale √† des arguments √©clair√©s et √©clairants.

Title Review:
True positive vs. false negative Although not confirmed by the competent health authority  I declare this opinion as a "true positive".

After the many partisan debates read here and there on the relevance  effectiveness  vulnerability  maliciousness or merits of this application  it seems that the controversy continues here ... and I observe that its opponents do not have not mobilized the best of them  preferring the invective or the death sentence to enlightened and enlightening arguments.

Application installed  activated and functional in a few minutes ... I do not feel deprived of my faculty of judging or of that of coming and going and I must add that  in all lucidity  I prefer to entrust the anonymous data collected to a public health authority rather than a private law third party.

2 more things! I have not observed any over-consumption of my iPhone's battery. I also confirm that the app does not make coffee ... Let's take care of ourselves!

Title Review:
Seems like a good app Although not having tested all the functionalities because not having declared the disease nor received a notification  it is difficult to judge correctly  but the app is simple and clear to use. Author: iFrodo
Title: Install√©e pendant 2h avant un d√©placement √† l‚Äôext√©rieur, d√©sinstallation aussit√¥t apr√®s.
Review:
Belle ergonomie, mais aucune transparence sur les donn√©es. √áa me parait le minimum qu‚Äôon puisse contr√¥ler ce qui est enregistr√©, quand bien m√™me ce soit des donn√©es anonymes. Exemple, savoir nombre de contacts, quand...

L‚Äô√©tat s‚Äôautorise √† faire des statistiques sur ces donn√©es (c‚Äôest une des justifications avanc√©e par C√©dric O pour l‚Äôapproche centralis√©e), et nous utilisateurs nous ne pourrions pas consulter en toute transparence ce qui est enregistr√© au moins nous concernant? Cela ne me parait pas acceptable.

Sans compter tous les d√©fauts de l‚Äôapproche centralis√©e choisie, r√©sum√©s en grande partie par cette excellente analyse de Nadim Kobeissi, Docteur en s√©curit√© et cryptographie, ayant d‚Äôailleurs effectu√© son doctorat au sein de l‚ÄôINRIA : https://nadim.computer/posts/2020-05-27-stopcovid.html

R√©sultat: D√©sinstall√©e aussit√¥t apr√®s. Cette absence de transparence est r√©dhibitoire pour une application de ce type. Sans compter toutes les failles conceptuelles du protocole ROBERT, tant en terme de s√©curit√© que sur la confidentialit√©.

Je d√©conseille donc fortement son installation.
Title Review:
Installed for 2 hours before moving outside  uninstalling immediately after. Nice ergonomics  but no transparency on the data. It seems to me the minimum that we can control what is recorded  even if it is anonymous data. Example  know the number of contacts  when ...

The state authorizes itself to make statistics on this data (this is one of the justifications put forward by C√©dric O for the centralized approach)  and we users could not consult in full transparency what is recorded at least concerning us ? It does not seem acceptable to me.

Not to mention all the shortcomings of the centralized approach chosen  largely summed up by this excellent analysis by Nadim Kobeissi  Doctor of Security and Cryptography  who also completed his doctorate at INRIA: https: // nadim. computer / posts / 2020-05-27-stopcovid.html

Result: Uninstalled immediately after. This lack of transparency is crippling for an application of this type. Not to mention all the conceptual flaws of the ROBERT protocol  both in terms of security and confidentiality.

I therefore strongly advise against its installation.

Author: Fredodido14000
Title: Application dangereuse
Review:
Au final, le rapport risque/b√©n√©fice de StopCovid, √† court terme plus encore √† long terme, nous semble fort d√©favorable. Parce que c‚Äôest une solution locale √† un probl√®me mondial, parce qu‚Äôelle risque de renforcer le sentiment de fausse s√©curit√©, parce qu‚Äôelle banalise les m√©canismes de surveillance num√©rique, parce que les applications de contact tracing sont inefficaces. Le tra√ßage des contacts avec une application ? ¬´ Ce n‚Äôest pas dans la culture fran√ßaise ¬ª assurait Christophe Castaner le 26 mars. Le ministre de l‚ÄôInt√©rieur ignorait-il que deux jours plus t√¥t, le Conseil scientifique Covid-19 se donnait une nouvelle mission, l‚Äô√©tude d‚Äôune strat√©gie num√©rique permettant ¬´ l‚Äôidentification des personnes ayant √©t√© au contact de personnes infect√©es par le virus du Covid-19 ¬ª ?
Deux semaines plus tard, le 8 avril, le ministre de la Sant√© et le secr√©taire d‚Äô√âtat au Num√©rique levaient le voile sur l‚Äôapplication StopCovid. Apr√®s la controverse sur le choix d‚Äôun syst√®me centralis√©, le refus d‚Äôutiliser les API propos√©es par Apple et Google, et l‚Äôabsence de collaboration √† l‚Äô√©chelle europ√©enne, le Premier ministre avait pr√©par√© les esprits √† un enterrement de premi√®re classe.
Title Review:
Dangerous application In the end  the risk / benefit ratio of StopCovid  in the short term and even more in the long term  seems very unfavorable to us. Because it is a local solution to a global problem  because it risks reinforcing the feeling of false security  because it trivializes digital surveillance mechanisms  because contact tracing applications are ineffective. Contact tracing with an application? "It's not in French culture" assured Christophe Castaner on March 26. Was the Minister of the Interior unaware that two days earlier  the Covid-19 Scientific Council had given itself a new mission  the study of a digital strategy allowing "the identification of people who have been in contact with people infected with the Covid-19 virus ‚Äù?
Two weeks later  on April 8  the Minister of Health and Secretary of State for Digital Affairs lifted the veil on the StopCovid app. After the controversy over the choice of a centralized system  the refusal to use the APIs offered by Apple and Google  and the lack of collaboration on a European scale  the Prime Minister had prepared the spirits for a first-class funeral .

Author: TE Lawrence
Title: Prot√©gez vos proches & prot√©gez vos donn√©es.
Review:
Tr√®s sensible √† la protection de mes donn√©es personnelles, je n‚Äôutilise pas Google et autres Facebook. Mais j‚Äôutilise l‚Äôapplication StopCovid car elle a le potentiel de sauver des vies et r√©pond √† un tr√®s haut standard de protection de la vie priv√©e : les donn√©es collect√©es sont anonymes et stock√©es sur votre t√©l√©phone.

Lors de l‚Äôannonce par le gouvernement du lancement de l‚Äôapplication StopCovid pour identifier et stopper les cha√Ænes de transmission du coronavirus, je reconnaissais l‚Äôutilit√© m√©dicale √©vidente de l‚Äôapplication mais √©tais tr√®s dubitatif quant au respect de la vie priv√©e. En effet je n‚Äôavais aucunement envie que mon gouvernement ne garde un historique de tous mes d√©placements et contacts. Apr√®s avoir install√©, activ√© et test√© l‚Äôapplication, ces craintes regardant une atteinte √† la vie priv√©e se sont dissip√©es. 

En effet, apr√®s ouverture de l‚Äôapplication StopCovid, il vous est simplement demand√© d‚Äôautoriser l‚Äôacc√®s au Bluetooth de votre smartphone par l‚Äôapplication ainsi que l‚Äôactivation des notifications : point de num√©ro de t√©l√©phone, e-mail, noms, date et lieu de naissance, adresse, g√©olocalisation ou tout autre information permettant de vos identifier n‚Äôest demand√©. En comparaison, un magasin o√π vous avez un carte de fid√©lit√© a infiniment plus d‚Äôinformations sur vous que StopCovid ; sans parler de votre banque, des r√©seaux sociaux, de votre op√©rateur t√©l√©phonique ou de votre navigateur internet. 

A fortiori, le nom de votre t√©l√©phone (identifiant Bluetooth) n‚Äôest pas r√©v√©l√© car un identifiant anonyme est g√©n√©r√© et c‚Äôest donc uniquement cet identifiant anonyme qui sera d√©tect√© et enregistr√© par les smartphones environnant utilisant l‚Äôapplication StopCovid. De plus, l‚Äôutilisation de l‚Äôapplication peut √™tre suspendu √† tout moment, ce qui est pratique lorsque l‚Äôon est en contact avec des personnes contamin√©es tout en √©tant correctement prot√©g√© (pour soignants par exemple). 

Pour finir toutes les donn√©es collect√©es (donc uniquement un historique de contact d‚Äôidentifiants anonymes) sont stock√©es localement sur votre t√©l√©phone. En cas de test positif, c‚Äôest √† vous d‚Äôautoriser la transmission de vos donn√©es au serveur g√©r√© par le minist√®re des solidarit√©s et de la sant√©. Aucune transmission automatis√©e des donn√©es n‚Äôest possible et ici encore votre identit√© est prot√©g√©e : le but de la transmission √©tant simplement d‚Äôenvoyer une notification √† tous les smartphones qui ont √©t√© proches du votre pendant une dur√©e prolong√©e (variant selon l‚Äôalgorithme de l‚Äôapplication, si vous √©tiez dans un espace clos ou √† l‚Äôext√©rieur par exemple), et ce durant les quatorze derniers jours. 

Quant √† la question du piratage, m√™me s‚Äôil n‚Äôest jamais √† exclure, le hackeur ne r√©cup√®rerait que des listes d‚Äôidentifiants anonymes, ce qui n‚Äôa aucune valeur. 

Comme lors du confinement o√π il n‚Äô√©tait jamais aussi facile de sauver des vies qu‚Äôen restant chez soi, maintenant il suffit d‚Äôinstaller StopCovid et d‚Äôen parler √† ses proches ainsi que d‚Äôappliquer les gestes barri√®res, pour pouvoir ensemble surpasser cette √©preuve. 

Si vous avez toujours des doutes quant √† protection de votre vie priv√©e et donc ne voulez pas installer l‚Äôapp, soyez coh√©rent et agissez en cons√©quence : arr√™tez d‚Äôutiliser Google, Facebook, Instagram, Amazon, YouTube, arr√™tez les sms, Facebook messengers et WhatsApp, n‚Äôutilisez plus gmail ni celui de votre op√©rateur. En effet vos donn√©es personnelles sont infiniment plus expos√©es sur ses plateformes et services que dans StopCovid. Si vous n‚Äô√™tes pas pr√™ts √† vous passer des ces outils, alors votre exposition au risque par StopCovid est n√©gligeable.

Essayez et vous verrez !

PS : citoyen sensible √† la protection de la vie priv√©e, je ne suis aucunement affili√© √† une administration publique et fais ici part de mon opinion personnelle en toute ind√©pendance, bas√©e sur les connaissances et mon exp√©rience. 

Je vous remercie d‚Äôavoir lu cet avis, r√©dig√© par une motivation simple : b√¢tir un monde meilleur, en prot√©geant la connaissance et r√©flexion. Aussi appel√© intelligence collective. 

MM
Title Review:
Protect your loved ones & protect your data. Very sensitive to the protection of my personal data  I do not use Google and other Facebook. But I use the StopCovid app because it has the potential to save lives and meets a very high standard of privacy protection: the data collected is anonymous and stored on your phone.

When the government announced the launch of the StopCovid application to identify and stop the chains of transmission of the coronavirus  I recognized the obvious medical utility of the application but was very skeptical about the respect of privacy. Indeed  I did not want my government to keep a history of all my travels and contacts. After installing  activating  and testing the app  those concerns about a privacy breach were dispelled.

Indeed  after opening the StopCovid application  you are simply asked to authorize access to your smartphone's Bluetooth by the application as well as the activation of notifications: point phone number  e-mail  names   date and place of birth  address  geolocation or any other information allowing your identification is not requested. In comparison  a store where you have a loyalty card has infinitely more information about you than StopCovid; not to mention your bank  social networks  your telephone operator or your internet browser.

A fortiori  the name of your phone (Bluetooth identifier) ‚Äã‚Äãis not revealed because an anonymous identifier is generated and it is therefore only this anonymous identifier that will be detected and recorded by surrounding smartphones using the StopCovid application. In addition  the use of the application can be suspended at any time  which is convenient when you are in contact with infected people while being properly protected (for caregivers for example).

Finally  all the data collected (therefore only an anonymous ID contact history) is stored locally on your phone. In the event of a positive test  it is up to you to authorize the transmission of your data to the server managed by the Ministry of Solidarity and Health. No automated data transmission is possible and here again your identity is protected: the purpose of the transmission is simply to send a notification to all smartphones that have been close to yours for an extended period of time (varying according to the application  if you were in an enclosed space or outdoors for example)  and this during the last fourteen days.

As for the issue of hacking  even if it can never be ruled out  the hacker would only recover lists of anonymous identifiers  which is of no value.

As during confinement where it was never so easy to save lives than by staying at home  now all you have to do is install StopCovid and tell your loved ones about it as well as apply the barrier gestures  in order to be able together overcome this test.

If you still have doubts about protecting your privacy and therefore don't want to install the app  be consistent and act accordingly: stop using Google  Facebook  Instagram  Amazon  YouTube  stop texting  Facebook messengers and WhatsApp  no longer use gmail or your operator's. Indeed  your personal data are infinitely more exposed on its platforms and services than in StopCovid. If you are not prepared to do without these tools  then your risk exposure from StopCovid is negligible.

Give it a try and you will see!

PS: citizen sensitive to the protection of private life  I am in no way affiliated with a public administration and here express my personal opinion in complete independence  based on knowledge and my experience.

Thank you for reading this opinion  written with a simple motivation: to build a better world  by protecting knowledge and reflection. Also called collective intelligence.

MM
content: Protect your loved ones   protect your data  Very sensitive to the protection of my personal data  I do not use Google and other Facebook  But I use the StopCovid app because it has the In addition  the use of the application can be suspended at any time  which is convenient when you are in contact with infected people while being properly protected  for caregivers for example    Finally  all the data collected  therefore only an anonymous ID contact history  is stored locally on your phone  In the event of a positive test  it is up to you to authorize the transmission of your data to the server managed by the Ministry of Solidarity and Health  No automated data transmission is possible and here again your identity is protected  the purpose of the transmission is simply to send a notification to all smartphones that have been close to yours for an extended period of time  varying according to the application  if you were in an enclosed space or outdoors for example   and this during the last fourteen days   As for the issue of hacking  even if it can never be ruled out  the hacker would only recover lists of anonymous identifiers  which is of no value   As during and services than in StopCovid  If you are not prepared to do without these tools  then your risk exposure from StopCovid is negligible   Give it a try and you will see   PS  citizen sensitive to the Too bad also not to have used the API of Apple which facilitates many things for the use of bluetooth in the background ..... The pretext of data protection is only the tree which hides the forest on devices whose hardware and software are 100% American ...... and honestly in a context of protection of users affected by the disease in all countries without exception it would be good to stop wanting to advocate difference and proprietary protocols which should not be the subject of controversy to the detriment of the effectiveness of the application ...

Even if it arrives a little late I will use it hoping that there will not be a second wave and that all this will not be useful in the future even if without the API of Google and Apple its use will remain well limited because users will not wake up their applications constantly to ensure that it can do its job .....

Le gouvernement a choisi de faire bande √† part, √† l'inverse de l'Italie et l'Allemagne qui utilisent le framework. Personne n'utilisera cette app si elle doit √™tre 100% du temps en premier plan √† vider la batterie ; ou pire encore, des gens vont penser √™tre en s√©curit√© alors que l'application ne tracke plus les contacts car elle n'est plus au premier plan... Title Review: Does not use the Apple / Google framework The application does not use the framework created by Apple and Google  which guarantees both security and data privacy  and more in a more pragmatic way does not impose on the application of having to constantly stay in the foreground  reducing the impact on the battery. The government has chosen to stand apart  unlike Italy and Germany  which use the framework. No one will use this app if it has to be 100% of the time in the foreground draining the battery; or even worse  people will think they are safe when the application no longer tracks contacts because it is no longer in the foreground ... In short  big failure on the part of the government ...
